message: I enter my neighborhood and soon reach my house.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I'm ho―"

name: タエ
message: "What's wrong with you, you stupid boy?!"
A clap of thunder greets me the moment I open the door. I know from experience that the ringing won't go away any time soon.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Do you have to shout?"

name: タエ
message: "How else am I going to get it through your thick skull?!"
Granny is perched menacingly on the landing, fuming as she scowls at me.
I've always wondered how such an old woman can make so much noise.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What are you mad about now?"

name: タエ
message: "Don't you know?! The lock!"

name: 蒼葉
message: "The lock?"

name: タエ
message: "How many times have I told you to lock the door when you go to work?!"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Oh... Did I forget? Sorry."
I was almost late for work this morning, so I ran out of the house in a hurry.

name: タエ
message: "Don't 'sorry' me! What did I do to deserve such a forgetful grandchild?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "What do you want from me? I forgot, okay?"

name: タエ
message: "Because you overslept again. You're 23 and still completely hopeless! Are you trying to make your grandmother cry?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "I said I'm sorry, didn't I?! Everyone screws up sometimes!"

name: タエ
message: "You could get a gold medal in screwing up! How many times is it now?!"

name: タエ
message: "You are completely hopeless!"
Granny is shaking with anger. The veins on her forehead are bulging.
This is serious. She's fainted after getting too worked up before.

name: 蒼葉
message: "I get it! I get it! I'll be more careful, so stop shouting already!"

name: タエ
message: "...Hmph. How many times have I heard that one? How can I rest in peace if you still can't take care of yourself?"
Granny snorts and stomps back into the kitchen.

name: タエ
message: "You still standing there? Come in before you freeze."
...She seems to have settled down for the moment.
Relieved, I take off my shoes and head inside.
We might get into shouting matches like this on a daily basis, but we actually get along pretty well, all things considered.
The fact that she can still yell like that is proof that she's healthy. I think her yelling is one of the things I'm going to miss when the time comes.
I'm really grateful to her for raising me all by herself. Not that I'd ever say that to her face.
Granny is in the kitchen, in the middle of serving up whatever she was sauteing in her frying pan.
I wash my hands at the sink, grab two sets of chopsticks off the shelf, and set the table.

You might be wondering where my parents are. They were never the type to stay in one place.

Even when they lived here with us, they would up and vanish for months―even years―at a time.
It was always like that, even when I was little, so I eventually got used to it being just Granny and me.
When they stopped coming back all together, I was surprisingly okay. I guess I have Granny to thank for that.
After all the trouble I caused growing up, I just want to treasure the time I have left with her.
A simple life is all I need.

name: タエ
message: "Let's eat."
She lines up the food. Somen noodles, tuna, stir-fried shiitake mushrooms and boiled greens, fried fish, and miso soup.
I sit down with Granny and put my hands together.

name: タエ
message: "Eat up."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Thanks for the food."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Granny, this is delicious."

name: タエ
message: "Is it, now?"
Being chased by the police made me hungry, so Granny's homemade cooking really hits the spot.
While stuffing my face, I feel a sharp pain shoot through my skull.
Here we go again...

name: タエ
message: "Another headache? Don't forget to take your medicine after you eat."

name: 蒼葉
message: "I won't."
I've suffered from frequent headaches ever since a youthful indiscretion landed me in the hospital. This is the second one today.
No one's ever been able to figure out the cause. Ever since it started, I've been taking the medicine Granny prescribes.
Did I mention Granny has a medical license? Yeah, she's kinda like the village doctor, always giving neighborhood folks checkups and meds.
She has quite the reputation for being safer than other, less competent doctors who just take your money.
I can vouch for that. Her pills are the only thing that have ever helped my headaches.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Thanks for the meal."
After I finish eating, I take my medicine, clear the table, and head upstairs.
